Reviews.Title: PC Monitor/Xbox 360
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I brought this TV as a monitor for my computer.I like that the speakers are built in and if you have hdmi on your computers video card it reduces the need for an additional soundcard and audio cable.My only complaint is that there is a pc/dvi mode for the hdmi ports that makes the pc image look really clear and it was difficult to find it existed at all.  For the first week of use the text was very blurry on the monitor and it was only through reading on message boards that I found this option needed to be changed.  It is not an obvious option as I had been through the whole menu on the TV many times.  Once this option is set Windows looks great at 1080p.I also have xbox 360 hooked up to the second hdmi port and that looks great as well.Overall this is a very nice TV or monitor for 250 bucks if you are going to be sitting pretty close to it when using it.One other negative might be the stand as it doesn't really allow you to do anything.  What you see is what you get.  It's not a problem for me though.

Reviews.Title: Samsung quality......knock on wood
Reviews.Author: M. Bailey "Snookums"
Reviews.Content: OK....so here I was looking for a bedroom TV to hook up to my bluray and Netflix streaming. Finally gotten rid of the old clunker Haier tube TV from years ago.At first, I was taken by the design of a Vizio 26" somewhat widely carried by many retailers and also on the internet. So I went out and bought it at a local retailer. Psyched. It fit perfectly in the intended bedroom spot. Looked great too. Dead remote....couldn't get past the first set-up page. Tried everything. Very pissed off. A bad omen. Such disappointment. Returned it for a refund.Then.....I discovered this Samsung. Always liked Samsung. Even though the size was a bit smaller and it looked like everybody else's flat screen, I found that it is 1080p with a 120khz refresh rate. Granted the 1080p res isn't anything to write home about with such a small screen, the 120hz refresh rate (better pic with fast motion) hooked me along with the LED illumination. Bought it. Set it up. Hey! It works!! Fantastic picture.Pros: Samsung - 120hz refresh rate - sturdy remote control - slim design - excellent picture.Cons: NONE really. But....there is no audio output on this particular model. You must rely soley on the set's speakers. Some people have complained of this, but they should have inquired first before buying. Some complain of the audio quality, but...if you go into the settings and work with the set's audio equalizer a bit you can get it to sound quite nice for a set of it's size.  Remember, this is a small set intended for the kitchen, bedroom, dorm or study. Not a home theatre. Part of this could be worked around if you have a bluray with audio outputs.

Reviews.Title: With a PS3
Reviews.Author: Tinker
Reviews.Content: This is used exclusively with The Boss' PS3 console, and it's a very nice screen.  Coincidentally, the day this was delivered, she brought home a similarly-priced, identically-spec'd 24-inch Toshiba from a local B&M;, and the differences are night-and-day.Both have a stunning picture, head-on, but as you move off-axis from directly in front of the screen, this Samsung holds color gamut at far greater angles than the Toshiba, and remains viewable at least as far to the side as you can go and still see the screen.  Colors may not be so great at that angle, but you can see them.  With the Toshiba, all you see is a dark panel.We previously had a Sony Trinitron CRT connected to the PS3 console, and I thought it worked mighty good at that role.  I'm not a gamer, but when I look over her shoulder now, I can see parts of the games I've never seen before, and not because of the wider aspect ratio.  Stuff that was hidden in the dark areas now pops out.This is the first LCD television I bought, and I bought small and cheap because of the problems inherent with LCD screens.  This one has sold me.  Still have to be careful with brands and models within brands, but I like 'em and am actively shopping for a larger screen for the living room.As a bonus, The Boss says the games look so much better - and different - she can go back and play her old games all over again.  If she does that, this set will have paid for itself in a few months.Highly recommend this where it's size fits the size of the room.  Fantastic, lucky, first buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: DyseMan
Reviews.Content: The TV is great it has a nice bright picture and it is crystal clear.  I like the 120Hz refresh rate it makes sports look better.  The only thing I was unaware of was the lack of audio outputs.  I wanted to hook this TV up to speakers and I can not do so because there an no audio outs what so ever.  Other than that the TV is everything that I expected and I would go with a Samsung again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Not "Internet ready" as advertised
Reviews.Author: Mark L. Dyson "Spinny"
Reviews.Content: Before I wrote this, I searched the net for a fair definition of the phrase "Internet ready" as applied to a TV. Universally, including Amazon's own definition, you can expect an Ethernet port, and usually some means to connect via wi-fi, either built in or by adding an adapter.My first hint of trouble was the lack of an Ethernet port.  The next hint was the absence of any mention of networking in the manual.  I connected a Samsung wi-fi adapter (one that based on the supplied chart should be the correct model). No dice.  I have another Samsung HD TV that does work in this manner, so I'm familiar with the procedure and have the online Samsung documentation for connecting a 5000 series unit to back my efforts. It simply did not provide any network configuration options.I contacted Samsung tech support next. At first the tech said it should have worked, but when I insisted it didn't he went away for an extended period to look further. When he returned, he apologized but stated this TV can not be connected to a network.And that's it.  It is advertised as being " Internet ready" when it in fact is not.  That is false advertising.I give it two stars overall instead of just one because apart from the falsehood it appears to work as your run of the mill small screen HDTV and the picture isn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: Great for small room.
Reviews.Author: Hear & Now
Reviews.Content: We redecorated a small room and mounted this TV at eye-level while sitting. Whoa. Crisp, clean image running off the antenna. Picked up the $15 articulating mount. Makes it easy to adjust viewing angles to different sitting positions. Great "other TV" for family gatherings when you don't want to watch what the crowd is watching.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Mikey
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but there aren't very many for this product so I decided to do one.I have this tv in my room hooked up to my play station. Picture quality is very good and sound is not bad either.Pros:120 hz1080pgreat priceenergy efficient.Looks good in bright environments.Cons: The stand is very wobbly. I like to rest my feet on the desk but i can't now because it wobbles the tv. which is really disappointing but I'm sure there is something I can do to fix it.Conclusion: I'm giving this tv 5 out of 5 stars because it was exactly what I was looking for. A solid tv, with the specs I wanted at a great price. 5 stars for the tv. 1 star for the stand. I have only had this tv for 2 days now so I will update if I have any further issues.

Reviews.Title: Samsung's "Clear Motion Rate" is NOT 120Hz Refresh Rate
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after being misled into believing it was capable of producing a 120Hz refresh rate, which turned out not to be the case. Samsung's "Clear Motion Rate" is not equivalent to refresh rate, and I'm not even sure what exactly it does to enhance video smoothness. That being said, it's still a decent TV for $220, (which it was at the time of the review, $250 not two days earlier when it was purchased).If you're looking for a 22-inch LCD LED TV with a 1080p native resolution, this product will suffice. Just be sure you understand that you're not getting a 120Hz refresh rate-capable set; the refresh rate is the standard 60Hz.One more thing: there's no audio jack on the rear of the panel, so you can't plug in headphones. Not too big a deal, but that would've come in handy for discreet, late-night viewing where nearby persons may be sleeping.

Reviews.Title: Almost Gave this TV 2 Stars
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bingo
Reviews.Content: I actually did give this TV 2 stars at first, until I read a review by Chris informing me of the PC/DVI mode he found.  I was about to start the process of returning it, and I've only had it for a few hours so far.  My primary use for this TV is a computer monitor and will soon hook up a PS3 to the other HDMI input.Here is how to turn the PC/DVI mode on.  It is most counter intuitive.  It really is simple though:1. Plug in PC to HDMI/DVI port on back of TV2. Push Menu button3. Scroll down to (Input) Source List Push <ENTER>4. Scroll to Edit name Push <ENTER>5. Scroll to HDMI/DVI Push <ENTER>6. Scroll to PC or DVI/PC Push <ENTER>7. Now Exit the menu, you're finished.You will notice the picture changes when you scroll over PC selection.  The picture for the PC should be clear, text should be clear!

Reviews.Title: No audio output!
Reviews.Author: Edward Tripp
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to find that this TV lacks even the most basic audio output, a headphone jack. I cannot understand why Samsung chose to save a few cents and not include user outputs. Furthermore, the built in speakers are tinny and weak--thus my preference for headphones or my own speakers. Otherwise, the TV is fine, with a very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: great little tv
Reviews.Author: Anita K. Ohm
Reviews.Content: Got this TV and love the size, the picture quality, the sound.  It all works for me.  If you have a tv unit that does not have a big space, this is the answer.  It is a terrific buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, if you don't mind the sound & NO exteranl headphone/speaker jack
Reviews.Author: Casus Belli
Reviews.Content: Great TV, if you don't mind the sound & NO exteranl headphone/speaker jackThat pretty much sums up my review for the Samsung model un22d5003bf.I bought one locally and was briefly extremely pleased.PROS:It it an LED HD TV.It supports 1080p High Definition resolution if you have it available on your station or media. Most stations (even digital ones) still broadcast many programs and movies in 480p and non HD DVDs are in 720p.It has a "simulated" 120 Mhz refresh rate to reduce blurring during fast motion, such as sports events, action videos, etc.  Samsung calls this "Clear Motion Rate 120"It has 2 hdmi & 1 usb port/s.It can double as a PC monitor and is very clear for either reading or gaming.It has a thin profile and is lightweight for wall mounting.It has several adjustments allowing one to get the most out of the tiny back facing stereo speakers.CONS:As has has been said, the screw-in base is somewhat feeble and unstable, and leaves one with an  insecure feeling.It does not have true but rather a simulated 120 mhz refresh rate, "Clear Motion Rate 120" for fast moving images.As with most TV's I've found the internal sound quality to be inherently inadequate.It lacks an external headphone/speaker port.The killer con for me (worth 2 out of 5 stars) was No external headphone/speaker jack. This did not allow me the option of plugging in my superior external speaker system or my headphones when I needed to keep the noise level down and not disturb anyone.This was the first time that I purchased any TV that lacked this option and I was truely surprized that anyone, especially Samsung, would create an otherwise outstanding TV and not provide an external headphone jack.Samsung customer service verified that there was NO work around to hook up my external headphone or speaker system on this unit, so I sadly had to return it.I was told that the samsung hdtv model un22d5010 might have an external headphone jack, but I have not been able to confirm this with an actual owner or technical person.The model un22d5010 does appear to be identical to the un22d5003bf in every other way, so it may be the better TV for me if I can confirm that it actually has an external headphone/speaker jack.For persons who are satisfied with the intrinsic speaker sound of most TVs, and forsee no need for external headphone use, then the Samsung model un22d5003bf is an otherwise very good, albeit somewhat expensive (due to the newness of LED technology) HDTV.For the rest of us, make no assumption that a new TV will come with an external headphone option that we once thought was ubiquitous.

Reviews.Title: An Impressive TV/Monitor So Far
Reviews.Author: Tom Lawson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV to replace a 17 year old 13" Magnavox and a 10 year old ViewSonic Monitor, so far so good. It doesn't have many inputs and the Component and A/V inputs are shared (meaning you can't have both plugged in at once, or if you can I haven't figured out how yet). The picture quality really is excellent, especially as a widescreen monitor. I have an older PC system and am running it through the TV via a DVI-HDMI cable. There is no VGA input on this TV, which I was expecting (because I didn't read the specs carefully enough). The picture quality is also excellent as a TV; I have a VCR and DVD player connected to it as well as some gaming systems and they all look great. I can't comment too much on the sound as I have all my electronics hooked up to my stereo receiver. It should be noted however that this TV has no audio out so you can't hook up headphones or external speakers directly to it. For it's size and probable use though, the audio sounds good. It was easy to set up, with all the controls being pretty intuitive. My only real problem with the TV would be the stand. It seems stable enough and I have no fear that it will tip over or break, but it's non-adjustable. This isn't too big a problem as the TV has a pretty wide viewing angle, but it still seems like it should have some adjustments on it. Overall I'm very satisfied with the TV so far, though I've only had it a few days.  Will it last as long as my Magnavox? Odds are it won't, especially as I'm using it as a dual purpose unit, but for however long it lasts, I think it'll be a good little TV.

Reviews.Title: 22" Samsung HDTV
Reviews.Author: Don Finch
Reviews.Content: I  bought four of these to place in guest bedrooms and the kitchen.  They are clear, not to big, but big enough.  The picture is excellent, and I am proud of my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing clarity, unreliable color...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Picture Quality great, colors, not so much; I bought this TV after researching every TV 22-24" for my small bedroom. The TV I am replacing is an amazing Samsung LN19A650. The minute I plugged this in I found the color of the picture absolutely atrocious. I called samsung and we went through changing some of the settings around, spent 2 weeks trying to make it work, I even bought the Disney "World of Wonder" TV calibration DVD to get the best settings, nothing doing.The color is not *always* horrid, but in most scenes it's almost as if they just make up colors. Oh look, red, lets make this bright perfect primary, oh, that's grass, let's make it bright as can be, all oceans must be intense blue, oh, khaki, who needs it. That would be not horrible but my goodness, faces come off super peachy or really tan and monochromatic, often jaundiced. faces of brown or olive people can be very washed out, it's really awful. So i went to best buy to check out the TV's on display just to make sure i didn't have a wonky set, the tv's there were the same. Again, most scenes were perfect but too many exhibited the same problems i was having with the one i had bought, washed out neutrals and exaggerated greens and blues and unnatural skin tones. I tried all of the pre-set settings as well as custom settings. Movie mode was the most normal but still too many scenes exhibited poor color interpretations. I then bought the 22" LG led tv (LV2500) and in comparison the Samsung picture was so much crisper with no background picture noise but the colors were so much more reliable and consistently appropriate on the LG.[EDIT} In the end the best setting for me ended up being turning all the colors way way down. Now the colors are better some faces end up a little off color sometimes, but for the most part it's pretty good now.Everything else about the samsung is just fine.OUTPUT/INPUTS: Yes, there are limited output/inputs, if you want more options than the 5003, the samsung un22d5000 is the EXACT same TV except with more input/output options. I bought the TV very aware of that but having more speaker volume was important to me and the 5003 has a total of 10Watts whereas the 5000 has a total of 6Watts, no idea if that actually makes a difference.MOTION RATE/REFRESH RATE: Regarding the 120hz drama, it's a little confusing for them to have marketed this TV like that but anyone who is buying it for the 120hz should know enough that refresh rate is never described as clear motion rate and they could have figured it out before buying the tv. For TV watchers 60hz vs. 120 on a tv this size won't make a difference, not to mention there is no other TV with a 120hz under 32". No idea on what that means for gamers, there's a discussion on amazon about this, consensus seems to be that 120hz is not better than 60hz.SOUND: Yeah, not so hot. In some circumstances the "surround sound" set to on it much better, usually movies. Unfortunately it isn't so good for television shows.VIEWING ANGLE is poor, but dealable, just gotta make sure to sit eye level to the TV.The colors were almost a dealbreaker for me, thankfully I was able to find a setting that worked, quite happy with my tv now. Now the sound is the most bothersome thing.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Not 120Hz, it is 60Hz !!
Reviews.Author: SD "Miss_Nostalgia"
Reviews.Content: First things first, this Samsung UN22D5003 is not 120Hz, it is 60Hz and I find it as no coincidence that after the Black Friday Sale this was corrected. This item's original 120Hz description along with a few reviews are misleading and outright lies. I bought this television from Amazon on Black Friday in-part due to being assured by these inaccuracies, and now following returning this item, writing this review and seeing the ratings of `5-stars' and the 120Hz to 60Hz details adjustment by Amazon after the fact , I'm just fuming.Ultimately this television from the start of use was disappointing. I bought it primarily for gaming and this is not a gaming TV. At 60Hz gaming on my PS3 had the dreaded `ghosting' effect, as well as movies, and cable. Also the sound was poor even after utilizing an HDMI cable. I utilized every input and settings available to make sure this television wasn't salvageable, yet it's simply crap. Lastly the 120 cmr (clear motion rate) is a deception. DO NOT BUY THIS!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed doesnt cover it...
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: I bought this set from another online retailer, but felt it was worth leaving a review on Amazon as well.First the positives.SCREEN: For a $180 TV, this LED screen is great.  Decent black levels.  Good color.DESIGN:  Good looking set.  Very slim, especially compared to other low end LED's in this range.  Not as thin as my 46" Samsung LED, but still not bad.SIZE:  Perfect size for my home office.Annnnd now the negatives.SOUND:  Terrible.  Just plain terrible.  Anyone who says the sound is great must have hearing issues or just not care about sound quality.  Its completely devoid of any low end.  No bass at all.  Gun shots in The Dark Knight sound like cap gun from my childhood.  Music is pathetically bad.REFRESH RATE:  This is listed on many sites as a 120Hz set.  They dont just say CMR 120, but literally list it as 120Hz.  This is not true.  This is a 60Hz set.  This is just false advertising at its worst.AUDIO OUT:  There is none.  NONE.  Not even a dang headphone jack.  How on Earth does this make sense?!I will be returning my set.  Probably.

Reviews.Title: Huge disappointment
Reviews.Author: Dave N.
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tv that could go from my bedroom to my pc to my RV.  What I got was a tv that went from my pc, to my bedroom and back to the store.  The color was way off and no control settings would fix it.  After spending hours on the phone with Samsung, they suggested I hire a home calibration service from Best Buy or the like.  First of all, the calibration service would cost more than the TV did so that was a non-starter.  Secondly, I've been in the computer support business for ... scary thought... over 20 years, so I know how to calibrate a monitor/tv so I'm not going to pay someone for something I do myself all the time.  Samsung's support said they would take it in for service and they would be sending a shipping label via email.  After a two day wait, I decided to return it to the store instead.  Thanks Target for their understanding.  It has been three months now and Samsung still hasn't sent a return shipping label.I will never buy another Samsung product!!!!!!!March 31, 2011 updateAfter looking around for another 22 inch tv I thought I was going to end up with a Samsung anyway as it had the resolution I wanted for use as a second monitor for my computer.  I looked at Vizos, Sharps, Sonys, etc. and came across a closeout on the now discontinued Sony 22BX320 for $189 at Shopko.  I really wanted an LED tv with 1080 resolution but settled for a 720 Sony and am quite happy.  The default color was a little off but I only had to change the to add a little green and I'm done.  It couldn't be easier.The TV is hooked up to an AppleTV so now I have unlimited Netflix streaming and iTunes access.  I wish the tv was a little bigger but if it were bigger, it wouldn't fit in my RV when I go on trips which is the reason I went with this size anyway.  The size if fine for my bedroom.Too bad Sony is dropping out of the small TV market.  I would have liked an updated version of this TV but I'm more than happy with what I have especially at the clearance price I paid.  Oh, this model has a room light sensor so the picture is adjusted to room lighting.

Reviews.Title: A dramatic discount from prior model UN22D5000NFXZA
Reviews.Author: China Dreamer
Reviews.Content: This new model replaces the 2011 model that has only 1 digit difference in model number: UN22D5003 instead of UN22D5000. The UN2D5000 is a FAR SUPERIOR MODEL in EVERY WAY - design, looks, contrast ratio (3.2 million to 1 in the UN22D5000, versus 22,000 to 1 in the UN22D5003). The UN22D5000 has optical out audio, component adapter & RCA stereo in adapter, 2 HDMI in, and a separate PC video in, and a separate PC audio in (and automatic PC input screen adjustment). Same 120MHz Clear Motion Rate. Elegant Touch of Color TV design with a silvery stem in the TV stand for the 2011 model UN22D5000, but cheap rounded plastic for the 2012 model UN22D5003! Yes, you read it right, a heaven and earth difference (or drop) in features and quality. In addition, note that in the 2011 model UN22D5000, it is the VERSION AY02 that is the SUPERIOR MODEL, compared with the older VERSION AY01. I had both. Samsung in general no longer makes high quality models in the 2012 "E" series, unless it is in the very high-end ones (in prices). You may still find some Amazon Marketplace sellers selling mostly used 2011 model (UN22D5000) but on rare occasion brand new - even though listed under used (check description for each seller), and be sure to ask about which version: AY01 or AY02. AY02 is vastly superior to AY01, like a different or newer TV. I can't explain the difference. My eyes tell me so and so would yours. When I first turned my AY02 model on, my heart skipped a beat - "Wow!" "I am in love." AY01 the older model is OK, but nothing that causes my heart to jump out of my chest or go into fibrillation. When I saw the new model UN22D5003 in the store, and the differences, I said to myself, "No way." Version AY02 of the 2011 model UN22D5000 (or UN22D5000NFXZA if you are searching for it on Samsung's site) is the way to go. Amazon may still have them but be sure to distinguish between version AY02 apart from version AY01. There is a big difference. For pennies a day, I would rather have version AY02 - how can one place a value on the delight of the senses? These are dirt cheap compared to what something like this would cost 9 to 10 years ago. In 2003, an NEC 20" LCD (heavy, bulky, low-resolution) TV/monitor at Costco cost $ 1,100 and it was considered a good buy! (Plasma TVs then? $ 15,000 an up to $ 50,000 to my best recollection!)

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22" LED HDTV from Amazon
Reviews.Author: HBR
Reviews.Content: I almost deleted this review request without comment, but I realized that when I was about to BUY a new TV for my mom who is in a nursing home, I read the reviews of others and made my decision based on those words. So here is what I think about the Samsung UN22D5003 22-Inch 1080p Clear Motion Rate 120 LED HDTV (Black) that I purchased for my mom.First of all, it came, not only by it's posted delivery date, but I received 2 notices that it was on schedule to be delivered early. It was, yea! That was a bonus.Secondly, it was easy to set up. Pretty much plug and play.And as for product quality, the picture is bright and easy to look at, the audio is clear AND my mom can work the remote without a problem.All in all, I am most satisfied with this TV and with the service I received.

Reviews.Title: Why this tv deserves only 1 star
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I bought this television looking for a compact HDTV that offered 1080p and a 120hz refresh rate to use in my dorm room.Pros: Compact size, stunning imageCons: THERE IS NO AUDIO OUT!!! That means NO means of connecting to external speakers, NO way of using headphones, and NO way of connecting to a home theater.BUYERS BEWARE!It's a shame, I like everything else about this TV

Reviews.Title: I'm bitterly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Barbara Greenfield
Reviews.Content: I hate to be the bearer of bad tidings, because I’m such a Samsung fan, but I have to do it.  I am utterly disappointed with my recent purchase, the UN22D5003 BFXZA Samsung  LED TV. I currently also have an 18 month old Samsung  40” LCD TV that I absolutely LOVE.  The color & picture clarity are spot on – I’ve even had people remark to me how great my picture is.  This is why it was a no brainer when it came time to purchase a second TV.When I first received the UN22D TV, the color was OFF – overly saturated with yellows & purples, but not consistently, and not on every channel.  I was on the phone with Samsung’s customer service multiple times, and even with tweaking different settings, nothing helped.  At this point, being a Samsung brand, I was sure I had received a rare  ‘lemon’, and returned the original to the retailer for a new UN22D.  To my utter surprise & disappointment, the replaced TV was no different than the 1st.Now I’m back on the phone with Samsung, and they’re telling me I need service.  Honestly, this TV doesn’t need repairing, it needs to be a different TV all together.  I was even on the phone with Samsung's higher level customer service people, as well as on their Facebook account, begging them not to make me go the servicing route, but I got nowhere. Even if servicing would help, which I'm convinced it can't, I resent having to service a product that I just bought.I'm really not happy with this TV at all - I would NOT recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great small TV for bedroom.
Reviews.Author: Gary Andrew Weller
Reviews.Content: Good picture and quality television for the price.  The only negative is the sound.  The volume isn't there.  There is hardly a difference from volume level 20 to 40.

Reviews.Title: Will not play video thru USB, VERY deceiving description.
Reviews.Author: sfc
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV purely for the USB input so I could play videos from a external hard drive or jump drive. This tv will not play them. This is the information right from the Samsung web site.Connect Share JPEGConnect a thumb drive or digital camera quickly and easily. User-friendly interface allows access to videos, a music playlist and pictures via the remote.Not an option with this TV. Last Samsung I will buy. My new LG brings up a menu on movies upon the inserting of a jump drive.Buyer beware!!!!!Samsung UN22D5003 22-Inch 1080p Clear Motion Rate 120 LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: NOT a 120hz tv
Reviews.Author: D. Herasme
Reviews.Content: This is not 120hz. This is 120MCR Clear Motion Rate. Samsung use this just to make you think it is 120hz. I returned it after it was opened and discovered it is not 120hz. Samsung list the TV on their website as a 120 Clear Motion Rate TV. So, I dont know why amazon insist in having it listed as 120hz.DO NOT buy if you want a 120hz tv that is 120hz.

Reviews.Title: samsung 22"
Reviews.Author: badipete
Reviews.Content: was refurbished. sound is bad. first time i have had a problem with a refurbished item. .live and learn thru life

Reviews.Title: Decent picture, no line-out for audio
Reviews.Author: J. Angelo
Reviews.Content: Samsung quality, decent 1080 picture, remote is intuitive, but I didn't think to look for an audio-out jack on it- all the other 7 TVs I have bought recently had one, so why look for something so obvious?But this TV doesn't have any audio line-outs. No digital coax, no optical, no stereo RCA, no even a crummy 1/8" headphone jack. I bought it to use with an XBOX and had to buy another adapter to use HDMI for the picture with the sound from the XBOX going to a receiver. A TV with HDMI input and NO audio-out jack is a dead-end. Cannot recommend this TV- I bought a Westinghouse for half the price, same size, with the correct inputs and outputs, with 1080 picture.

Reviews.Title: Samsung tv
Reviews.Author: brit
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this tv for a kitchen or bedroom. The sleep timer is more tedious to access than other tv's. No button on the remote. You have to go to the on screen guide each time. Otherwise a great tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN22D5003 22Inch Clear Motion Rate 120 LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: SMG
Reviews.Content: I have always been very happy with Samsung products, unfortunately this product does not measure up.If you are straight in front of it you get a great picture, but move a little below, or off to either side, and the picture is distorted. Not typical for Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV and the price is even better.  After finding this offer online,  I looked around locally to see if this was a good deal. This TV usually runs someone about forty to fifty dollars more if you buy it in a store.  This is my first LED TV and I couldn't be happier.  It showed up within three days of purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: This a very good TV!
Reviews.Author: Doug Garrison
Reviews.Content: Iam using this TV mainly as a Monitor for my PC and to use with my Xbox 360 and for this purpose it works great.I wanted to address the 2 main complaints I have read about this TV , that being 1) no audio out for headphones or speakers and 2)use as a PC monitor. In regards to the first issue , if you are using a pc or 360/ps3 the headphones or speakers would utilize the audio in jacks since the audio source would be either the pc or 360/ps3.The only time you cannot use headphones or speakers is when you watching broadcast television or cable.That being said how hard could it have been to add the audio out option?In regards to use as a pc monitor I have read a few reviews stating that they could not get the colors or resolution right when using HDMI to hook up to a PC, I had the same problem at first but the solution was simple. You have to rename the connection to pc if using a HDMI cable or PC/DVI if using a DVI adapter by pressing first the source button then the tools button and then edit name. You will see a list of options then select PC. After I did that the screen looked great. These directions are in the manual but I was screwing around with color and contrast options for 2 hours before I decided to take a look. If your image has borders go into your PC's videocard options and look for the overscan adjustment.All in All I am very happy with the product , but I deducted a star for the lack of audio out and for the stand which I think should be more solid.

Reviews.Author: PUD
Reviews.Content: Purchased to replace an older, heavier LCD TV in the kitchen. I have it mounted to an under-cabinet flip-down VESA mount. Video source is a Directv HR22 HD DVR. The picture is more than acceptable especially after tweaking the settings. The Audio is certainly lacking but passable after some tweaking. The TV itself is thin (good) but flimsy (bad). When pulling down from under cabinet, it flexes so much that it pops the HDMI cable right out of the port. I've adjusted the Omni-mount flip-down mount to where it barely holds the TV up when pushed up out of the way, so when pulled down carefully, the flex is minimized. Normally I wouldn't care much about how sturdy an LED TV is, but this just points to the overall low quality feeling of the unit. I have other Samsung TV's, and this one just doesn't seem to be up to their usual standards; especially at this price point. For now, it's okay; but as a constant upgrader, this one might be replaced sooner rather than later...

I use one in the room where I have my bike trainer because I have to have something to make sitting on a bicycle and pedaling without going anywhere tolerable. Reviews.Author: Eric Katsov
Reviews.Content: This tv has a USB port, but it will only display pictures or play mp3 music through it. When I hooked up my external hard drive via USB it did not play any videos on it because it simply does not have this option. Advertising is deceptive for this product because it says it will play your media files, but says nothing about no be able to play videos ... on TV ...from your USB drive. Other than that it is just a standard TV and by the way it is not that thin.Also, if you are planning to put it on your wall, you have to make shure that is positioned about 2 inches away from the wall because HDMI and Power cables plug directly perpendicular into the back of this TV and they need space behind the TV to stick out. I am glad I did, because I had to use my already installed wall mount that holds the TV 2 inches away from the wall to be able to hook up my Roku via HDMI.

Reviews.Title: False Advertisement
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I was lead to believe that this set had a refresh rate of 120Hz. That is a flat out lie.It has a SIMULATED 120Hz refresh rate.It actually only accepts a signal up to 60Hz and then SIMULATES 120Hz with that signal. The really sad part is that I bet most of the people who have bought this product have never bothered to open the user manual, and are thus none the wiser.If you are looking for a 120Hz set, don't buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Refresh rate is deceptive.
Reviews.Author: Red Cloudy
Reviews.Content: I nearly purchased this television because it was the only affordable option that combined all of the current features (Backlit LED, 120Hz refresh, etc.) in a small screen (<32"). After doing research on TigerDirect.com, however, I learned that the "120Hz" figure only refers to a bogus measurement that Samsung uses to determine "the thinnest line a TV can display in a moving image." The actual refresh rate is 60Hz.You may not care, unless you anticipate using the active-shutter glasses that NVidia uses for its 3D imagery, as I did. Still, the product description is misleading, and you may be able to find a better value by searching for plain old 60Hz televisions.Edit: Other reviewers have noted that the processor can enable 120-hz refresh, but after reviewing the information on Samsung's website, I am not convinced that this TV is capable of producing the two distinct images per 60hz cycle that would be necessary for active shutter 3D glasses. I would be interested to hear whether anyone else has attempted to use the unit for this purpose. It seems that it is designed primarily for predicting intermediary images when, for example, tracking movement in a sporting event.As for owning the television, I clearly stated that I hadn't purchased it and only wanted to indicate my reasons for choosing an alternative. My review didn't presume any knowledge of picture quality, software performance, etc.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, not a good monitor, "Clear Motion Rate 120" is nothing
Reviews.Author: Chuck Nasty
Reviews.Content: For starters, this display is not 120hz as Clear Motion Rate 120 would imply. Obviously there are no 120hz inputs, but there are also no features in the TV to turn 60hz images into 120hz like most "120"-boasting TVs have.I want to use it as a monitor, but it displays the PC image very poorly. For one, the red tint on the display is very overpowered for some reason and I had to lower it in order to get a semblance of normal white. Then the display is not pixel-perfect. The display oddly blurs and sharpens things, so as to make TV/games look better and smoother, and to be honest, they do look better. However, on a PC desktop, this means you can't just have a normal pixel and a sharp font. Words are either blurry or have the nasty artifacts that come with the "sharpness" setting and there is no way to just make it display 1920x1080 normally without filtering it heavily, making it no good for a monitor outside of playing games.Other than that, it has great colors and a fantastic black level, and lots of great options to adjust the image. But I'm upset about the 120 thing being meaningless and it being no good as a monitor. The stand also can't be adjusted at all, so if you want to view the screen at eye level, you must stack it on top of something so that it is up to your level.

Reviews.Author: Patti
Reviews.Content: My second Samsung television.  Not the best sound quality but nothing you can't fix with a cheap set of speakers.  Very nice little tv.

Reviews.Title: The perfect screen

Reviews.Content: Finding an LED TV under 24 inches that does 1080p without breaking the bank was difficult, but through the Warehouse Deal I snagged this for under $200. It currently serves as my second computer monitor, or my desktop gaming screen. I like to occasionally stream to Twitch or record gameplay, so having a second screen next to my computer setup was ideal. I can use this TV at anytime as a computer monitor which is another plus!I am a little biased when it comes to Samsung TV's; I own three now (living room, bedroom, and now office) because they consistently provide a clear, crisp picture; they have great color tones, and they have never given my a single issue. This TV is great!

Once you name the HDMI input as PC then the screen looks instantly much better.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Hacks "Mr. Hacks"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great HDTV and a great computer monitor, you can have both with this device!The Samsung UN22D50003 allows you to hook up up to two HDMI sources and one composite source and one USB device all in a 22" package.If you are looking for a good starter HDTV and not sure where to go in terms of 60Hz or 120Hz or whatever, go with this device.Just about anything else on the market will sell you a 22" 720p device with poor image quality. This device offers no compromises. It gives you everything you want in a TV, everything you need in a TV, and everything you've ever wanted for a computer montior in a single device.This TV is also ideal for folks who use their computer a lot.  Adjusting the Picture to "Movie" mode dims the screen ideally for both movie watching and to reduce eyestrain for folks who like to work on their computer. (Just remember to get up and stretch for about 5 to 10 minutes about every hour to avoid any physical complications from working too long infront of the computer.)I couldn't ask for a better TV and such a low price.  If you don't make a whole lot of money, like myself, but have been saving up for something you can use that does everything except the new high-end stuff like smart-TVs do (i.e. web, built-in PVR, Picture-in-Picture, etc.) but are good a pinching pennies, get this TV. Then with the money you save, go buy a Roku 2 XS and sign up for Netflix or Amazon Instant Video for a low fee.The only flaw with this device is that there is no Audio Out ports.  It would be great if someone could come up with a hack that if you plug in a Bluetooth dongle and have like a Bluetooth Wireless Speaker Adapter (Logitech makes this device), and a digital amplifier hooked up to a set of old stereo speakers, you could significantly enhance the sound. (Did I mention I like to do stuff with computers?)  But that seems to be the only flaw other than you might want to some sort of plastic screen cover to ward off the dust and prevent scratches to this pristine screen. Otherwise the cat or the kids will touch it with their dirty mits.Also, for the folks who don't know how to install the stand with the screws, remember: Lefty Loosy, Righty Tighty.  But I do agree, there should have been like an extra screw and a strong piece of fishing line to really secure it to the wall.Final pitfall, the mercury lamps lighting the back lights. If TV fall down and go boom, TV will need to be put into a plastic garbage bag before getting it fixed.To end this review, I would like to state dramatically **The day has come for an affordable HDTV/Computer Monitor that everyone can enjoy!**

Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind that this TV's MSRP is around $250, and I purchased it for $188, and this heavily factored into me deciding on this TV. I got a lot of bang for my buck, as a college student I don't know if I would have spent the extra $65. However the price doesn't change the attributes of the TV. I got this to put in my mom's kitchen, its low enough for typical cupboards, but big enough that I can see sports scores from anywhere in the kitchen. The TV looks great, set up was incredibly easy, and its less that 2 inches thick, so it doesn't waste any space. Also, the differences between this and the 2012 model seemed minimal to me, especially in aesthetic appearance and how the back is set up. My only gripe is that the base is not as sturdy as other TV bases I've come across. However, it also does not swivel, and the base is perfectly fine when it's just sitting there. Another Samsung I am extremely pleased with.

Reviews.Title: Great buy, good TV

Reviews.Title: Not good for game playing.

Reviews.Title: Good

Reviews.Title: Great TV.  Worth the purchase!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This TV is great.  We use it in our bedroom to replace an old 19" CRT with builtin VCR that we had had for way too long.  The sound & picture quality are great. It is easy to set up and get going.  Plus, you get the brand recognition of Samsung which (in my opinion) puts out quality products.  Our main TV is also a Samsung and is awazing.Don't get me wrong.  If you are looking for a computer monitor or gaming system monitor, this may not be the TV for you however it isn't supposed to be. It's a TV not a computer monitor. The sound quality was so bad that I had to return it, even though I typically only listen to TV in our bedroom for 10min per night before I am fast asleep.  The sound was that bad that I couldn't handle it even for that short of time.Again, great quality TV with great picture, great sound and easy to set up and use.  You won't be disappointed in this.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and performance for gaming
Reviews.Author: Brian V.
Reviews.Content: I'm a gamer; Xbox 360, and I've been looking for the right gaming TV for sometime now. As a gamer I need high resolution, 1080p, and a good refresh rate to reduce motion blur. After adjusting settings for personal preference, the Samsung UN22D5003 provides the performance I need from a TV for gaming.This 22 inch Samsung TV provides a sharp picture and wonderful bright colors using an HDMI connection. Even though the TV is 60Hz with 120 Clear Motion Rate, it has no issue keeping up with the fast pace action of Battlefield 3.If you're looking for a great TV for gaming I strongly recommend the 22 inch Samsung UN22D5003. And yes some gamers prefer a smaller TV for gaming.Note: I don't use the built-in speakers. I'm using a set of Tritton gaming headsets for all audio.

Reviews.Title: My Mom loves her new TV
Reviews.Author: Amazoniac
Reviews.Content: My Mom has never owned a flat panel.  So I thought i'd treat her to one on Mother's Day.  I did some research first about LEDs vs LCDs and read a few product reviews as well.  For the price point I was trying to be mindful of this was the best choice for me.  The tv arrived a little sooner than I was expecting so my Stepdad didn't get a chance to hide it for me.  Aww well, it all worked out and most importantly my Mom is happy.  She raves about the picture quality and the size is a perfect fit for her small bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Sik403
Reviews.Content: Using this TV for a month now, I am impressed by the picture quatity. But one thing, you cant use the VGA cable directly with this TV, you need Component Adapter (BN39-01154W). Which charge $20.HDMI work perfects, no issues with this.Overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expect from Samsung and more!
Reviews.Author: deschene2k
Reviews.Content: I've been a Samsung fan ever since I bought my first cell phone, which was a Samsung, 15 years ago.Since then, I've had other Samsung phones, our home's primary HDTV, desktop computer monitors, a recent laptop and now this 22" LED HDTV for our guest room.  This UN22D5003BF (okay, maybe their marketing people need to work on model names) has more than I need for connections, automatically detected my cable providers recently changed all-digial channel line-up including identifying and removing scrambled channels after the autodetect pass AND I didn't have to use their adapter box!  The picture is stunning (like my Samsung monitors and laptop).  Add the ease of removing any channels that I didn't want, naming inputs (for our old Samsung DVD player that got replaced with a Samsung Blu-Ray this past Xmas), it's automatic settings for everything from time to display brightness to picture format (based on input), etc. . . .  I couldn't be happier.  And finally, as always, Amazon.com came through on price and delivery yet again.

Reviews.Title: Very Good but pricey for features
Reviews.Author: marcodream
Reviews.Content: Great small unit although a little pricey for features and the sound is not great as with most all lcd and plasma tv's. Probably could have purchased a larger screen with same or more features at close to price paid !

Reviews.Title: Nice Television
Reviews.Author: John Stewart
Reviews.Content: We are very happy with this television. We bought it to replace a similar one that gave up the ghost. The color looks good and it sounds good as well. We have this TV in a small guest room/sitting area connected to Dish Network.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: B. May
Reviews.Content: This was bought for my sons bedroom and has been a great little TV. All of our TVs are Samsung and never had any trouble with any of them.  Amazon got this to us exactly when they said they would - Love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY WITH THIS PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: LOVIN IT
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A VERY QUICK & EASY SETUP & I AM VERY HAPPY WITH MY PURCHASE. PICTURE IS GREAT & SOUND IS GREAT

Reviews.Title: I cannot hear it very well when on treadmill
Reviews.Author: Francis Bacon "Parrothead"
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Samsung television fan as of the last few years.  I specifically looked at Samsung when my wife and I decided to 'upgrade' our workout room television set for Christmas 2011.  The picture quality is adequate for us.  Unfortunately, it sounds like the sound is coming out of a tin can (to me).  The sound isn't any better than the old clunker we are getting rid of.  Running the volume up to 100% still wasn't great.  I'm thinking - No problem, I will just buy a cheap pair of amplified computer speakers and plug them into the TV.  I couldn't figure out how to do it by the user manual so I'm thinking I have now become my grandparents trying to get that new VCR hooked up!  Anyway, I called tech support to help me with an obvious easy fix that I just couldn't figure out.  But No!  It turns out it cannot be configured for this simple solution!  So I'm going to return this television for this very reason.  I might upgrade to a slightly larger Samsung TV but I will pay closure attention to the speaker system.  Our 32" Samsung in our bedroom has great audio quality.  I am a little hard of hearing so this television, in a quieter atmosphere, with someone with better ears than mine might be just what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: Misadvertised to the max but still a great display.
Reviews.Author: Colton Hass
Reviews.Content: This Tv is only 1920 x 1050 NOT 1920 by 108 which is full 1080p I realized this when Hooking up my Computer to the display and when I was in 1920x1080 There were pieces of the screen missing but When It was at 1050 It went right to the edge as it's supposed to. Also as for the 120hz Clear motion, This is another example where they say it is something that it is not just to market it to people. You cannot output 120hz video to this monitor(tv). It only shows up as a 60hz monitor. The 120hz marketing might be someway of making 60hz look better but it is not 120 Hz.That being said. This display is amazing It is a nice pixel density very good colors and the matte finish is always a big thumbs up. I am debating getting another for a dual monitor setup with my new computer I am building... We shall see.Also If your missing some options in the menu it is most likely because you are still in store demo mode... but most of you don't need to know that.

Reviews.Title: Lack of Internet support
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I have been on the watch for a small HDTV with wi-fi or ethernet connection. As I browsed thru amazon's internet ready products I got excited to find this samsung product at the price it was. Only to be disappointed with further research to find this particular model does not support any kind of internet connection not even with a USB adapter.Pro: Based solely on other reviews this product works well as a second monitor after finding it's feature to optimize specifically for use with computer via HDMI.con: If you live with multiple people, like in a dorm room for college, this NOT having the AUX out put for sound could cause some turmoil between you and your roommate.

Reviews.Title: No power after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Lawrence J Zaker
Reviews.Content: After having owned the television for 2 months, there is no power to the set and it has to be mailed back to New jersey.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good.
Reviews.Author: AEJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after reading some good reviews. When I bought it, I was led to believe that it was a 120hz set, as was stated in the description until just a few days ago. It is a 60hz set in actuality. I'm unhappy about this, but it's not the end of the world.Pros:*Thin and light, as it's supposed to be.*HD media looks very good.*Holds colors very well from side-to-side angles.*Volume is very sufficient for the smallish room it is in.*Sleek design.*Very low electricity consumption.*Fairly inexpensive.Cons:*Not 120hz, as advertised.*Non-HD media looks anywhere from crummy to just okay/kind of good. From my reading, this is not restricted to just this set, and is prevalent in many HDTV monitors.*Picture washes out quickly when viewed from even slightly below or above level.*While cost is manageable, there are similar sized(even slightly bigger) sets that cost $10-$20 less, though I cannot comment on their comparative quality.I like this TV. I do wish that the original description had been accurate, as I spent more on this set for a feature it did not in actuality have. For non-HD media, I usually have to scale down from the 16:9 ratio to 4:3 ratio to make it look good enough to not be bothered. As stated though, this is a widespread problem with many HD type TV's and monitors. I personally paid $249 for this set, and it has since been as low as $239. I think it is a pretty decent product for either price.Thank you for reading.

Reviews.Title: Gaming TV
Reviews.Author: Phan
Reviews.Content: After playing on a old SDTV for 5+ years, I decided it was time for an upgrade. I wanted a TV big enough for my room, but not big enough that it'll hurt my eyes(I can't play on big TVs). A 22" was the perfect size for me. The TV arrived in perfect condition and took less than 10 mintues to set up. I've had the TV for about 2 weeks now and have not been disappointed. I bought this TV for gaming, and so far, I have not notice any controller lag. I would defintely recommend this TV to any friends. Also, I haven't noticed the "wobbly stand" that the other reviewers have commented on.Pros:Great, clear graphicsGreat soundNo controller lagCons:NOT 120Hz as advertisedNo headphones jackOverall: I am completely satisfied by this purchase and would purchase it again if given a second chance.

Reviews.Title: not real 120hz
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: This is not real 120hz. I purchased it with the intent of using it as a computer monitor in 120hz. Not only that, but it did not come with the screws to attach the monitor to the stand.

Reviews.Title: Very disppointing
Reviews.Author: sedels
Reviews.Content: I wanted a 1080 bedroom TV. The reviews of all the smaller TVs (26" and under) are at best mixed on the sound quality, so I took a chance on this set. I found the sound unacceptable. My spouse commented that it sounded like a speakerphone. Because there is no audio out jack of any sort, I couldn't easily use external speakers I returned it immediately and exchanged it for the 720p Samsung 26EH4000. The sound was vastly improved (not to be confused with good) and was listenable. Good picture quality. If you have the space for the larger set, I strongly recommend moving up.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a Multi purpose high end TV.
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: This is my first 1080p TV and I've happy I purchased this TV. I did my research about high quality smaller TV sets and this is one of them for sure.There are multiple HDMI ports and the screen has a touch power and setting buttons if you don't want to use the remote which has a nice look to it as well. The abundant settings to mix and match to what you want as your display is perfect as well. I've been using this HDTV for gaming, my PC display, and watching TV shows and movies as well and all of these uses work great with this TV.The display is crystal clear and it turns off on it's own if left on to long which is great if you just happen to forget to turn it off. The stand is also sturdy and not easily knocked which is great since my desk is somewhat wobbly.The only downside to this TV is that there is no audio jack for headphones on this TV, but that really isn't much of an issue for me since I'm using a headset that uses the TV's composite input.

Reviews.Title: head on view only
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Bernier
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture ONLY when you watch it head on.  The picture gets worse as you move from the straight on viewing.  I am very disapointed .  I expected better from Samsung.

Reviews.Content: with the exception that it isn't 120 hz.  it was 120 clear motion rate...  but when setting up the tv it only said it was actually 60 hz

Reviews.Content: It has some odities on some channels no matter what mode you use it in and cuts off the edges but has a crispt and clean look and signal. Get it and enjoy.

Reviews.Content: We use it in our kitchen, and it is perfect for the small area we have it in. The picture is excellent and it serves our purpose for watching while cooking and eating meals. We own another larger screen Samsung TV, and are very pleased with that TV too.

Reviews.Content: Great little TV. Only a few complaints:-No audio output.-The base is very wobbly. It wobbles almost and inch from side to side.-The buttons on the front are impossible to see in low light. I had it for weeks before I realized it even had buttons. This isn't usually a problem because I usually use the remote. The remote, by the way, is very good. One of the best I've used in a while.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: William A. Broderick
Reviews.Content: Quite a bargain.  Easy to setup, easy to use.  Everything shows very well.  Integrates very easily with my sound system.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv for my son who is an occasional gamer. He uses it for XBOX, WII and TV. This product has all the connections you need to run a great envornment for a small room or as an extra computer monitor for work or home. Samsung has produced a great product. Offers very deep blacks and very bright screen settings. The speakers are phenomenal. I never let my son set the volume past 17 (goes to 50 i believe). He can connect cable box, Xbox and wii all at the same time, and if he had a computer he could add that to the input as well.This TV also offers a digital player that will allow you to play your digital movie copies from an external hard drive. You can control the movie like a dvd player from the remote, once inside the environment. This has proven to be a great tool to have when you have kids that dont put dvds away after they watch them. It has allowed us to preserve the dvd while still allowing my son to watch his movies.If i had a quarrel with this TV it would be the backlight. It isnt noticeable when you have an input running (TV, Game), but when it is a black screen, you can see the white lights behind. A very nit picky observation, but not enough for me to drop it to 4 stars. Great TV that offers a lot of versatility.

Reviews.Title: Great Price
Reviews.Author: Kevin R. Mullins
Reviews.Content: This product arrived on time and was ready for deployment right out of the box.  The setup was easy and the quality of the display is great.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV 22"
Reviews.Author: Michael V
Reviews.Content: Great little TV for my needs. Nice picture, and the sound not bad at all. Great price and features. This TV fits perfectly for where I have, and so far no problems.

Reviews.Title: What can i say? Love this thing
Reviews.Author: Tommy L.
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for me, might even passed this down to my sis or cousin so i can purchase another one. this displays the content great in 1080p. my recently purchased Chromecast is beautiful, my games like The Last of Us and God of War look wonderful. Remote is comfortable to hold if anyone wondered lol. Overall my experience with this TV is a 10/5. Greatly Satisfied.

Reviews.Content: TV was great until it started turning its self off and on over and over again. I'm very upset I paid more to have a name brand and all I got was a tv that isn't sure if it wants to stay on or not;( my husband read some reviews on different websites and found that there is a problem with this and they will warranty it if u pay to ship it off and wait several months for them to fix it and send it back;( not happy

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but...
Reviews.Author: M. Corvin "Corvinus"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 1080p tv to go above my wife's tub that was not too big (wide) and low profile (thin). This was literally the only tv that had these specifications under two feet wide that I could find.Hooked it up and had a really great pic and vibrant colors, but.,,The viewing angle sucks. I mean terrible. If you mount this tv on a wall up high (4-5 feet up) and you are sitting in a chair or in the ground the picture goes a blackish purple and what was beautiful now looks awful.So great picture and great price, but you need to have it on a tabletop or down low, parallel with your eyes, or you will be sorely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: A. Moskowitz
Reviews.Content: I did my research on many TV's to find the right one to replace the old 15 inch (diameter) TV. I wanted a TV that was at least 19-22 inches (diameter) and discovered that most 19 inch screens were only 720p.  My research found that there were ample models available with 1080p in the 22 inch (and above) models and that is where I maintained my focus. I decided to stick with what I know, and went with Samsung models, since I own 4 other Samsung models of various sizes, and have never had a problem.This TV was ready to go, out of the box, and sat perfectly on the counter, with setup taking only minutes. I spent $50 on a GOOD "Monster" HDMI cable, to make sure my picture quality would remain 1080p "quality".Needless to say, the TV works flawlessly, and the picture quality is exceptional. I have read other reviews that stated the base was "wobbly", but I have not had similar experience thus far. This is another solid purchase, if you are looking for a reliable Kitchen TV that has a respectable viewing screen. It also has a low profile, and fits easily under my cabinets.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: M. Miller
Reviews.Content: I love this TV and very pleased with this purchase. Great picture quality and perfectly suited for the guess bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: B. A. Schultz
Reviews.Content: No complaints on this TV. The sound could be crisper but who really cares. It's a basic TV that could even be used for a monitor. It's perfect for our family room. We view movies on our larger set.we have another Samsung and it has proved to be a reliable brand. An excellent TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Would have returned it
Reviews.Author: Woodshop Man
Reviews.Content: I would have ordered a Sony TV in the first place, but Sony didn't have one that fit under our kitchen cabinets.This TV has good color/sharpness in the DVD mode, but terrible in the cable mode. My previous tube type Toshibadidn't have this problem, so it's not the cable setup.On cable, it has a definite greenish ghosting.Now one of the HDMI inputs have failed in this TV and I'm forced to have it serviced.I would have sent it back, but it was a gift to my wife (she loves to watch NCIS while cooking) and so the 30 day return period had expired by the time I gave it to her.I'll probably end up using this TV down in my bar and getting her a new one.I will never buy another Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: Know what size you need
Reviews.Author: D from Norhole
Reviews.Content: A word of advice to people considering this TV. Know what size you need. Bought this for my grandmother to use in her bedroom. I haven't bought a TV less than 40 inches since they all went wide-screen. If you are using this in a kitchen or somewhere where you will be viewing it within 5 feet, it'll be a beautiful TV. Lots of features and great picture. However, it didn't work for what I needed it for. Ended up buying her another TV (40 inch) for her bedroom and hooking this up as a computer monitor. Works great for that too because I was able to clear room off her desk by getting rid of the speakers. Overall, great TV just know what size you need.

Reviews.Title: A great buy!
Reviews.Author: Amy Ludtke
Reviews.Content: Great TV and a great buy!  Works perfect in a teenagers bedroom.  Nice picture, cable ready, and really sleek too!

Reviews.Title: Nice small TV
Reviews.Author: Glenn Graham
Reviews.Content: Super TV, love it in the office. Perfect size. Only complaint is that there's no aspect ratio/zoom setting that matches the Comcast digital broadcast size perfectly. If you don't zoom (full image) there's a slight black line at the top and bottom (meaning that the picture has a wider aspect ratio than the TV). So I zoom the image which does two things. It zooms in and appears more like the image on maybe a 34 inch TV. But now you don't get the edges of the image and for many sporting events the score is partly off the screen. Also max volume level is just adequate, not great. But sound quality is excellent, so I'd rather have quality over loud noise. And the price was a great bargain, getting it on sale during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: small and dark
Reviews.Author: Dmama05
Reviews.Content: Bought for our bedroom and its a lot smaller than expected. We have it sitting on our dresser and unless you are eye level with it you can see anything on the screen.  Just doesn't work well for our space.

Reviews.Title: Clear bright picture.
Reviews.Author: D. Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I am so happy with the Samsung wide-screen LED TV I bought last year. Great picture, great performance.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and love the HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mary Ruth Richards
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for a guest bedroom TV.  It is the perfect size for this and I use it a lot when needing a retreat.

Reviews.Title: Excellent

Reviews.Content: Phenomenal price, no defects. Great picture quality, especially for its price. Easy installation and seamless use. Recommended buy. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22 inch TV

Reviews.Content: This is a good product , but it was too small for my bedroom. I returned this one and purchased a 32 inch TV.

Reviews.Title: Quality LED TV

Reviews.Title: Nice TC , Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Paul F. Fraser "Freddy Fraser"
Reviews.Content: Better than expected. Have this hooked up to reg coax at a vacation house and still te pic is very good.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for more
Reviews.Author: Jehovah T.
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to use as a monitor for my desktop and the two go together perfectly. I also stream movies off of netflix so the 1080p is really useful. The size is great for my room. I have a friend who has one of those huge tvs in his room and I think it's a bit of an overkill so when buying, I kinda wanted to go for something smaller. My opinion, the big tv's should be in the living room. Anyway, another thing I love about this tv is how light it is. Almost doesn't feel like you're carrying a tv at all. The sound quality, however, isn't the best, but it's not bad either. Guess it's really up to the owner's opinion on the sound quality. Anyway, one bad thing about this tv, and I'm assuming it's because of how light it is, is that the tv is very wobbly on its stand. Bump the table that it's on top of and the tv will shake enough to worry you, so be careful with this thing. Overall though, I'd recommend buying this as a bedroom tv or desktop monitor. Just don't let kids too near it.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG UN22D5003 22-IN TV
Reviews.Author: RICHARD T HALL
Reviews.Content: THIS TV IS GOOD LOOKING AND HAS GOOD FEATURES BUT IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A HD DIGITAL CABLE BOX YOU DO NOT WANT THIS TV. THE PICTURE IS PRETTY SHARP BUT THE COLOR QUALITY IS NOT GOOD.  MDMALLERS@COMCAST.NET

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Music lover
Reviews.Content: I like my new small TV. My old one did not have the HDMI cable slot. The only drawback I see is that it stays on all the time, even when it's turned off. I guess the energy consumption is minimal, but it's different.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth McFarlane "Your friendly American"
Reviews.Content: I got this around Christmas from parents in 2012 and I've been playing my games on it ever since.Pros:1080p HD (just like what it says)2 HDMI ports (I love that because I can have my PS3 and my Xbox hooked up to it)Stunning graphicsIt arrived fast is what my mother saidKind of cheap! Very inexpensiveCons:I really don't consider this as a con, but I will just tell you anyway.While I was playing Hitman: Absolution (over like 6 weeks ago) the graphics were really crappy on that game on the Xbox version on my TV. So I really don't know if it's the TV or the game...Overall: I give this 5 stars, it is a wonderful TV for your bedroom and for gamers! Get it!

Reviews.Title: every thing I need
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great and the size is right for my needs. I game alot so I was very happy with the picture quality and responsiveness.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN22D5003 22-inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black) [2011 MODEL]
Reviews.Author: Yolanda Taylor
Reviews.Content: My grandson loves his tv. Works great!!Just the right size for him.Mostly uses it for his video games but likes the color on his cartoons.

Reviews.Title: decent tv for the price

Reviews.Content: picture quality is crisp and vivid.  sound quality is mediocre (when watching tv, sounds like you're in a tunnel a little).  purchased this tv for the spare bedroom primarily to connect video game console to (to get them out of the living room).  it fits the purpose great.  quality product for the price.

Reviews.Content: Excellent picture, good sound. unobtrusive graphics (i.e. volume). I have this mounted on a wall so I cannot vouch for the stand that it comes with, but I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Very good

Reviews.Title: Kitchen TV

Reviews.Title: tv
Reviews.Author: Ms. Lucille A. Artuso
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my purchase.  The tv works greatand it fits right where i needed it to

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for my desktop computer
Reviews.Author: Mew
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a decent-sized monitor for my home desktop computer. But I needed something that would be reasonably priced and have a reputable brand name. Inquiries at my local electronics/appliance store yielded fruitless results. I finally found this Samsung 22-inch LED HDTV and am incredibly happy with my purchase. I'm able to do the work I need to on my desktop computer., and the fact that this is an HDTV allows me to High-Definition movies!

Reviews.Author: Burt
Reviews.Content: Works good, viewing angle critical for good picture. Purchased for use in an RV so the size was perfect for the location.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV

Reviews.Content: I love this Samsung 22-inch TV.  It is perfect for my kitchen when I am preparing dinner so that I can keep up with the news at dinner time.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: chucky
Reviews.Content: This a great TV for the price. The picture quality is beyond expectations.It fits great on the cable receiver in my bedroom. The size is great since I didn't want to mount it.  I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: great colors easy to use

Reviews.Content: best reception when using an hdmi cable rather than standard coaxial cable for hd programming. some channels still do not televise their programming on 1081 which means that not all channels will use this TVs full potential.

Reviews.Title: Excellent small HD TV
Reviews.Author: daveb
Reviews.Content: This is a very affordable small TV, and is ideal in a small room while viewing at a distance of 3 to 6 feet.  The picture quality is top notch, and looks as good as a 120hz TV.  While the sound quality is not good on the default settings, tweaking the equalizer as others have suggested for Samsung TV's works well.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Kathy in Boston
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for my bedroom. When I received it, I thought it might be too small; but the picture and resolution are great, so this TV worked out just fine.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Cypress Cowboy
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good.  Disappointed  that I ordered the smaller TV for my purposes.  Obviously my fault, but my wife loves it so its a winner.

Reviews.Title: Great TV 1080p & 120hz True Motion Technology

Reviews.Title: XBOX 360/Desktop Monitor
Reviews.Author: L. Snyder
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say, this thing is freaking beautiful. The screen rates are great, colors are good and It literally brings a depth to anything you are looking at. I like in a one bedroom apartment for college and the size is a perfect balance for comfortable viewing, gaming or writing essays with multiple documents open. The number of HDMI ports is a blessing and makes cabling much much simpler. With all of this in mind here are some problems that I had.1) you have to set up each input to format what type it is receiving. I.e. HDMI1 is "game" and HDMI2 is a pc connection. If you fail to do this the picture quality goes down and even makes text blurry.2) There is not a dedicated audio in for the "HDMI/DVI" connection which effectively means that if your desktop does not have an HDMI port your desktop audio cannot run through the TV speakers without an additional converter (around $30 more dollars). For myself, I use a DVI to HDMI cable and wear headphones. If your computer has an HDMI out this will not be an issue however alot of desktops these days have DVI instead (CURSE YOU DVI).3) the stand is kind of short, it was awkward for me when it was sitting on my desk so I use a little stand that the TV and stand sits on. Purely preference.4) the curved nature of the remote means that it falls of of any edge you place it near. Late night viewing can be a hassle as the buttons are not lit and everytime it falls off of the counter you have to go hunting for it.All in all, I gave the product 4 stars, I bought this item on sale and I love it, totally worth the purchase. While there are some "cons" with the product they are mostly preference based and probably will not effect most users.TL:DRGreat for xbox/pc/PS4 users as long as you do not use DVI connection. PRETTY.

Reviews.Title: Good picture - very thin form factor
Reviews.Author: K. Beasley
Reviews.Content: I bought this model because of the dimnesions ... I had a very tight space I wanted to put this in and minimal depth was critical.  The TV is only 1.6" deep but this is a bit decieving because you have to consider the input panel is straight off the back and the connector you are going to use will add to the depth requirement.  The picture is good and sharp with no perceptable motion ghosting (even though it is a 60Hz display) ... but I would expect that because its only 22" and 1080p.  Despite the number of reviews that bark about poor audio, I found that the sound is not bad considering the small size.  Booming, room-filling sound from a set of small, 1.5 inch speakers is an unrealistic expectation, (c'mon, folks ... these are basically laptop PC speakers).  As far as the complaints about no audio ouput, I checked the specs again and there is no mention of one, so I am not sure about this complaint.  Most configurations will drive this display with a cable box or sat reciever anyway ... If you need an audio source for exteranl speakers or headphones, just use the audio from the box\reciever (read: Y-adapter if you are not using HDMI).  Side-to-side viewing angles are resonable but you will need to angle the TV down if you plan on mounting it in an elevated position.  Just a small angle viewing upward will quickly wash-out the picture ... this is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.  Overall, I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but I would recommend another Samsung for a monitor
Reviews.Author: Sajid G. Mulla
Reviews.Content: I have bought and replace a lot of TV sets for a small business and regarding quality I would always recommend Samsung. I noticed small problems in this set that is common in all  sets of all brands now  and that is the build quality which is poor and  the inclusions of cheap plastic screws, and this set also has a poor quality wire which is only a small two prong instead of three.This TV has two hdmi inputs and component inputs this is fine if you have a newer videocard with a hdmi input, but compared to the Samsung B2230HD it just doesn't have the options of a vga input or  the magic angle viewing options that has standing, lean back, or other options for different viewing environments.The sound options does have a SRS option but it does not have an option for clear voice for low sound broadcasts or amplify sound option. I do like SRS but I don't like to turn on one option to amplify sound I like a variety of options and sadly this set does not have it.I knew this going in and was going to replace my B2230HD set with this since it has LED  and the B2230HD doesn't. The picture in this set is very clear for watching TV but that is not the only thing I use a set for. I decided to put this in the hotel room and stay with my old Samsung set. The stand is very small and does take less space but sadly it doesn't hold up because of the poor build quality of the stand.This is the sign of the times though all sets are smaller and leaner but I prefer a stronger build quality in my products since I grew up that way but sadly if I buy another set in this 22 inch set price range I know I will be disappointed.

The HDMI and coax plugs come straight out of the back (perpendicular to the screen), not sideways, so you won't be able to get this very close to the wall.Frankly, I liked the older model - Samsung UN22D5000 22-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black) [2011 MODEL] - better. Reviews.Title: TV does not stand up on its own
Reviews.Author: S. Mead
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV through Amazon and did not even get to the point of plugging it in. I attached the base to the TV (with the two included screws) only to have it flop forward toward the floor. On page 27 of the manual, it actually says that the TV does not stand on its own....I could not believe it when I read it!! There is an illustration of a "kit" that you have to order containing a string and one screw. You screw this screw into the back of the TV to affix one end of the string. The manual states that the owner of the TV must purchase an additional screw to be screwed into the wall or TV stand. Then the owner must tie the other end of the string to this second screw in order for the TV to stand safely. Where to order this kit....??? I could not find the answer on Amazon or on the Samsung website. Through the Samsung website, I did a live chat with one of their reps, who told me that the only place to get the kit was to call their sole parts supplier at an 800 number. I didn't even bother.... Inconceivable that a piece of string and a screw required for SAFETY would not be included with purchase! Sent the TV back to Amazon the next day.
