Reviews.Title: Pixelated
Reviews.Author: TomPiantanida
Reviews.Content: The package containing the TV and accessories arrived promptly.  When I assembled the base, attached the TV to a cable outlet and powered the set up, I discovered that there were clusters of "dead" pixels.  The clusters looked like black streaks or large droplets.  When there was no picture on the TV, but the power was on, the "dead" pixels were gray while the rest of the screen was black.  After several calls to Samsung, I reached the right person who told me to ship the TV back.  A UPS label was emailed to me to facilitate the return.  I put everything back into the original box and shipped it off to Samsung.  About two weeks later I received a box - not the original box, but one for a different TV - containing only the TV; no stand, power cord, remote, or manual.The first thing I did was to call Amazon, and the person I talked to - Daniel - was very helpful.  He was as bewildered as I was about why I had not received the manual and accessories, but then we both realized that the problem was with Samsung, rather than with Amazon.I immediately called Samsung, and it took more than a week of calling and talking to eight different people - two of them in the "Executive Customer Service Department" - before Samsung returned the stand and other accessories to me.

I had a Samsung TV before and I extremely pleased but I had to make piece with it while I was making preparations to move to another states.Residing in a new state and a new apartment I've decided to get this TV as a temporary means and then use it as my monitor while I buy a new PC next year. The Samsung 22inch TV is simply amazing as far as the screen goes but everything else is cheaply made, especially the TV Stand. Even the TV's manual recommends/teaches you how to install a string to the TV to prevent it from tipping over. The stand is that flimsy and cheap...but it somehow holds it place without tipping over, thankfully.As for the size...well...I have myself to blame for that because I was under the impression that it was at least 20inchs in height and not barely 13inchs....In conclusion, this TV does not worth the price advertised...it should have been no more than 150 dollars and I would have send it back but I really do need a monitor for my then PC...and since it is such a hassle to send it back, the best I can do is dissuade others from making the same mistake as I have.

Reviews.Title: *****DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG PRODUCTS ARE A RIP-OFF & VERY EXPENSIVE REPAIRS*****
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  Maybe $2,500.00 - $3,000.00 is not a lot of money for some folks to spend on a television, but it is to me.  This is money I'll never get back, nor derive true enjoyment, nor value from due to the DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG product that I purchased.  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems as in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as the same DEFECT in many other DEFECTIVE SAMUNG models.  This defect occurs upon start-up, and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture gets progressively worse over time and continuously declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00!Furthermore, I was informed that the repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel" that costs $1,300.00 for the part plus $279.00 to install, plus taxes......all told, another $1,719.16....at which point the technician basically stated, "just buy another TV."SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at a rate of 20% per year, and that they do not repair any of their products after 4 years!  Their own repair people told me to just buy a new set!!!If I save one family the heartache of losing they're hard-earned money on SYSTEMICALLY DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG TELEVISIONS, and a company that offers zero customer service....I'll be happy!  God bless....SAMSUNG CONS:No Customer SupportSystemic Panel DefectGhosting of imagesBurn-in on screenDistorted pictureVery expensive to repair

I haven't seen a TV that didn't have VGA inputs (I'm sure they exist) so it just didn't occur to me that it would not.  Why would I buy a 200 dollar 22 inch TV except to use it as a monitor/tv?  I can buy a 22 inch tv for 129 at the local big box and probably on  Amazon, too.  So, as a TV it might be fine.  But it is an under-featured TV for its price so it gets three stars.I may return it or I may not.  I've ordered a VGA to HDMI adapter cable with no idea if it will work or not.  Apparently that requires a video card that outputs digital in the VGA out rather than analog.  I don't know if mine does or not.  If the cable doesn't work, that won't reflect on the cable but it does mean this TV has to go back.

Reviews.Title: 22" Samsung hdtv
Reviews.Author: cr-618
Reviews.Content: This is a great hdtv ,we have it in the kitchen we have a 19'' 720p this 22'' 1080p. Great picture...

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN22D5003 22-inch LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Willa E Hammond
Reviews.Content: The size was perfect for the area where it was to be used. Very good reception. Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST TV TO BUY
Reviews.Author: BEVERLY A. CARROLL
Reviews.Content: I have a 46 inch Samsung HDTV-LCD, four years ago. I thought it was time to upgrade my television in my bedroom. Being as the Samsung has been number one for years, and that I have enjoyed my 46 inch, I , of course, had to get the Samsung. After looking for a great deal, I found the deal at Amazon.com. This 22 inch is a perfect size for my bedroom. The LED, I honestly do not see the big difference between that and the LCD. Always make sure you get a TV, with the 1080p. It does make a difference. Also, whenever you do buy a new HDTV, you do need the HD service with whatever you use for the programming. Without it, the picture looks too wide, and you can not change that format. Also, the color is much better and you don't have to change the adjustments each time you change the channel. I had mine for a week without HD service, and did not like what I was watching. Once I did get the service, my TV is a great as my 46 inch is. No matter what brand you choose, make sure you do get the HD service. This is very important, no matter what salesperson tells you that it does not make any difference. The latest is the LED, so stick to that. The LCD is going out, and that is why you can get super deals right now.  Like I did say, my LCD satisfies me 100%. If saving more money is what you want, and do not care if it is the LED, by all means buy it. Now this model is suppose to be 2011. It didn't turn out that way. Mine was made in October, 2012. It is the super slim model. Really light in weight. This is also the Series 5, which also means the best to buy. Really, Samsung is certainly the best choice in the Television entertainment world. You can not go wrong in this choice. You would thank me for giving you this advice. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good but a little disappointing
Reviews.Author: Beachcomber79
Reviews.Content: I just bought this LED HDTV.  I also have an LG LED HDTV which I love so am comparing to that.  The Samsung is super easy to set up, however no matter how much I tightened the screws on the stand, it still wobbles.  I should probably try using some washers and see if that helps.  My LG has no instability at all.This TV has great colour and has a USB input which was one of the criteria for me.  I tried a USB that I have some movies on, but the TV will only recognize and play either Photos or Music - it does not have an option to play movies and it won't.  I don't know if this was mentioned somewhere in the information prior to me purchasing and I assumed it would play movies on my USB stick as my LG will play whatever is on the stick.  This to me was very disappointing which is why I gave it 4 stars.  I recently purchased a new Blu-ray player that has a USB input so I play movies on the memory stick via the Blu-ray player, but I am still upset that the TV won't play them.  I do realize this was the 2011 model, but my LG LED TV is about the same age.Other than that, it's a great TV and I got it for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: A. Rey
Reviews.Content: TV is a solid choice and a terrific value. I am using it as a computer monitor and am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Unusable picture
Reviews.Author: George LaMontagne
Reviews.Content: Picture has flat colors with no brightness and no contrast with all adjustments set on full. Can only be viewed in a totally dark room without eye strain but the picture is still nearly useless. Save your money and buy a Panasonic or Sony. This is my second Samsung clunker product.

Reviews.Title: Sold on Samsung video
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: TV is great, only complaint is looking up at it (below center line)  Gets very dark.The higher up you go, the brighter it gets.  I have a big Samsung in the living room, and2 wide-screen Monitors for my computers, all Samsung.  One Computer monitor doubles asan HDMI video source from my cable box.  So I have Hi-Def in my man-cave.  The side-to-side viewing brightnessis very consistant.  ONE REAL PLUS for Samsung, is they ALWAYS include REAL BUTTONS on thedevice itself.  Too many TV and monitors, now are button-free, and if you don't havethe remote, you're dead in the water.  I am sold on Samsung video.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV, but I hate SAMSUNG's customer service.
Reviews.Author: MASA
Reviews.Content: This LED TV's picture quality is more than my expectoration, it's beautiful.Problem is I cannot register my TV via SAMSUNG USA web. I created my account, no problem, however SAMSUNG web's drop-down list for product registration doesn't have my TV's model #, UN22D5003BF, therefore the registration hasn't be completed, yet.I called to SAMSUNG's customer service but I couldn't get anybody within 10 minutes. So, I tried to sent e-mail to SAMSUNG's customer service but it's required to select model # from drop-down list.I haven't seen this much stupid web-config.

Reviews.Title: Super
Reviews.Author: X
Reviews.Content: This was a very good buy.  Shipping was very fast and the set works great.  The price was better than going to a box store.

Reviews.Title: Rattles!
Reviews.Author: greg pierce
Reviews.Content: It's probably a good t.v. When I got mine something was rattling around inside. I returned it, and was advised I would be getting a gift card for my trouble.Still waiting on that.

Reviews.Title: TV is good, but the TV -was- falsely advertised.
Reviews.Author: Billyg0at1991
Reviews.Content: I'm completely happy with the TV itself, except for the fact that it is smaller than I expected. There's only one major problem, though. When I bought this, Amazon had it listed as 120hz. Despite reviews saying otherwise, I figured that Amazon would at least be reliable in their product title/description. The fact that it's now listed as 60hz is incredibly frustrating. I could have gotten a bigger 1080p tv for the same price, but purposely went for this one because of the supposed refresh rate. Now TV prices have gone back up because it's after black Friday, and I'm left with a product that's different from the one I was promised. Thanks a lot, Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV however it Died after 1 hr of watching it
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: TV had a great picture and sound, however after approx, 1 hr of watching it, it died. Not sure why, however I was very disappointed with Samsung customer service, and to me that is the most important part of buying a product. They did not want to listen that i only watched it for 1 Hour, all they cared about is that i get it fixed at Marco's TV and Repair. The TV only cost $200, and now it will cost them at least $100 to fix it, and now have to wait 2-3 weeks for it to get fix. In the Past i only bought Sony becasue they had great customer service, however i wanted a small TV with 120hz refresh rate, and this sounded like a great TV, and it was for 1 hr. i just wish Samsung would have replaced it with another TV, instead of me going across town looking for this place

Reviews.Title: Pixel problem
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Great picture for 3 months or so.  Then .... one white pixel appeared on the screen.  No more in next few months, but if you are particular that becomes what you see.  Under warranty, but not worth the hassle as due to its size, you have to ship it to NJ which is the closest center to where I live, 1500 miles away in St. Louis.

Reviews.Title: No VGA
Reviews.Author: PaulaG
Reviews.Content: I misunderstood the PC input feature when I bought this TV. I wanted a TV and monitor in one as my laptop is VGA only. I bought an HMDI to VGA converter, which worked once then sent my laptop into a tizzy. I am returning it for that reason alone.I bought it on sale, so the price was great. The picture is very good but the sound is tinny. If I were to keep it, I would fiddle with the audio settings to see if I could improve the sound.

Reviews.Title: Not a 120Hz.
Reviews.Author: octavarium02
Reviews.Content: This TV does not have a 120Hz refresh rate as advertised! I can tell because I know how a 120Hz rate looks like and also if you play a DVD movie with an HDMI cable, it will tell you (on the TV display) the rate (60Hz). I haven't tried with a BD player, but I don't think it'll make a difference. Everything else about the little TV is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Frustrated
Reviews.Author: Busyfella
Reviews.Content: As for watching TV, the Samsung is great, both in picture quality and control.  My frustration is that I was buying the TV for use by a bedridden resident in a nursing home who needs to watch TV listening to the sound with ear buds.  I was totally unprepared that a TV would not have an audio jack as standard equipment and have wasted time and money trying to resolve the problem (to no avail).  I'm OK that some TV's do not have audio jacks, but when a TV does not, there should be a boldface warning to buyers.  I am real disappointed in Amazon in not making that disclosure.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Loie
Reviews.Content: The sound is terrible. I bought external speakers only to discover there was no audio outlet. The new speakers are now gathering dust and I have to crank the sound up to max to hear it across the room. The picture is not bad. Big mistake!

Reviews.Title: So nice!.....
Reviews.Author: drummergirl60
Reviews.Content: This is so nice and handy. Would definitely recommend! Nice phone protection and a place for cards and money....great to carry to places you don"t want or have to  carry a bulky purse.

Reviews.Title: Samsung kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: TV arrived in a very timely manner, good condition. Worked well right out of the box. Easily set up with minimal difficulty.

Reviews.Title: Poor manufacture
Reviews.Author: Robert Greathouse
Reviews.Content: The base does not attach securely to the TV. In order to work my girlfriend has to prop it up with a book. I was going to return it, or make a shim for it, but she doesn't want to fiddle with something when she has a working solution. Go buy another TV that will connect with it's base properly and be able to stand up.

Reviews.Title: not 120 hz dont be fooled

Reviews.Content: i bought this tv because it sounded too good to be true. so it was. Don't get me wrong this is an awesome little tv good sound good picture is good too but its no 120 hz i have a lg 42 inch lcd tv i bought on amazon there is no comparison lg 120 hz true motion killed this this samsung

Reviews.Title: Samsung 22" LED 1080P  HDTV----Short in Height
Reviews.Author: jbroc "jbroc"
Reviews.Content: TV was well packed and in perfect condition, arrived as scheduled.  An Amazon purchase.The TV fit on the stand fine, was easy to hook up to ATT cable.  Then the instructions became weird.  I followed instructions 1 thru 3 exactly as written which is called ''plug & play''.  BUT, after doing Instruction 3, written below Instr 3 is the statement...."Important, if your tv is attached to cable, skip step 3" etc.........duh, I've already done that and it took me out of the Plug&Play; mode.Wouldn't common sense say that if you need to skip Instr 3 that would be written right after Instr 2  ??Well I had to wing it on my own, could not get it to scan and save channels, & other things in the Plug&play; set up. Never have taken time to find out how.The sound on this tv is fine, not sure why all reviews on tv's this size get all upset about the sound so much.The picture is good, it has good tint, color and brightnes.BUT, THE 1st THING I NOTICED WAS THE HEIGHTH OF THE SCREEN....TOO SHORT AT 10.6 INCHES.  I REPLACED AN OLD 19" TV WITH A SCREEN HEIGHT OF 12 1/2 INCHES.The area of the rectangular screen on the Samsung is 196.8 square inches, and on the 19" is exactly 196 square inches.  Holy Moly..I would have figured a 22" tv would have at least 40 sq inches more than a 19" tv, not less than 1 square inch more.  YOU WILL DEFINITELY NOTICE THE SHORT HEIGHT OF THIS TV.I guess you could sell a 22" tv with only 3 inches in heighth...never gave it a thought.  I never saw anyone address this problem in reviews.  It's the only reason I gave it 3 stars and not 4.

Reviews.Title: no on/off switch
Reviews.Author: Glenn Camp
Reviews.Content: This model Samsung does not have an EXTERNAL on/off switch. No way to turn tv on or off except with the remote. My remote quit working and I couldn't get the tv to turn on in order to set-up a universal remote and could not turn the tv on. I took it to BEST BUY for them to rectify the situation and 'they' had no way of turning it on either.I had two remotes and neither would work.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this TV, I expected it to be 32-inch one but it turned out to be the 22-inch. I made a mistake while reading the size of the TV, anyway the TV is not bad. It's fair, especially for computer display!!

Reviews.Title: color is strange
Reviews.Author: frank
Reviews.Content: i connect this tv with my computer via hdmi. the color is really piss me off ,i adjust the setting again and again ,its still not that good! even worth than my original asus LCD! i mean ,dude ,this is samsung, almost the best monitor brand in the world. one word,disappoint !

Reviews.Title: NOT 1080p Viewable
Reviews.Author: mk
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a computer monitor.  DVI -> HDMI.When running at 1080p with Windows 7, the task bar, title bar, and leftmost desktop icons appear BEHIND the plastic molding!I had to lower the resolution to see the task bar.At lower resolution there is some dead "black" space in the margins of the viewable surface.This might not be noticed if used as a TV.

Reviews.Title: NEVER BUY SAMSUNG!!!!
Reviews.Author: LLN
Reviews.Content: I bought a Samsung tv in 2008 for over $3,000 which has since become a paper weight because Samsung REFUSES to support it product. This company is terrible and should be shut out of the US market for selling junk. DO NOT BUY THEIR PRODUCTS!!

Reviews.Title: TV

Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I couldn't see if it would've been a good one or not, normally I have no problem with Samsung products because I do own a few of them, but this one I have no idea what had happen that came to us broken and I didn't bought another one so far.
